results.title: The Interview [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Craig Monahan, Bill Hughes, Interview Films and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A haunting feature debut from Craig Monahan which explores the complex psychological exchange between Detective Sergeant John Steele (Tony Martin) and nervy suspected murderer Eddie Fleming (Hugo Weaving) during the hours of a claustrophobic police interrogation.The apparently ordinary Fleming is asleep in his apartment when his door is broken down and he is accused of nameless crimes. He is the only lead the tough, world weary Detective Sergeant Steele has and so begins a bewildering sequence of interviews where the crime and the many forces at work between the characters and their situation gradually becomes apparent. The nature of guilt, innocence and who or what to believe is rendered uncertain in this film as we are presented not with any concrete answers but with the fluidity of perception and the difficulties of defining truth. (Awards: Winner Best Original Screenplay, Best Film and Best Actor (Hugo Weaving) Australian Film Institute Awards, 1998)

results.title: Chopper [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dominik, Michele Bennett and Palace Films
results.brief_description: This AFI award winning film is based on the life of Mark Brandon - “Chopper” - Read, a notorious Australian criminal who became a best selling author, publishing 9 books of his life and times as a key stand man in Melbourne’s underworld. Eric Bana plays Chopper following his conviction for abducting a judge who was proceeding over the case of his best friend, Jimmy Loughnan (Simon Lyndon). Read ends up serving a 16 year sentence for his efforts, during which he shares a cell with Jimmy and has to contend with Keithy George (David Field), a crime boss who runs the prison. After an attack of violence instigated by Chopper, he kills Keithy and finds himself the target of numerous prisoners wishing revenge on him. As he sees it, the only way to escape the notorious H division is to get his friend to chop his ears off so that he can be transferred to another prison. Eight years later, Chopper is released and finds himself battling his own personal demons and psychotic episodes to try and adjust to outside life. All he can focus on is seeking revenge on arch enemy Neville Bartos (Vince Colosimo) and looking out for his girlfriend, Tanya (Kate Beahan). This special edition includes deleted scenes, theatrical trailer and footage of director Andrew Dominik and Eric Bana’s visit to Chopper in Tasmania while researching the film.

results.title: Breaker Morant [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: It is 1901, South Africa. The British war against the Boers has deteriorated into bitter guerilla warfare. A unit of the Bushveldt Carbineers, made up mainly of Australians, is ordered by the British High Command to fight the Boers on their terms and take no prisoners, orders that were to prove fatal for Harry Morant. Cast includes Edward Woodward, Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, John Waters and Charles Tingwell.

results.title: Mad Max II
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Byron Kennedy and Kennedy Miller Productions
results.brief_description: Mad Max helps a small community defend itself against gangs desperate for fuel. Set in a post WW3 world where gasoline is the only hard currency. Stars Mel Gibson, Bruce Spence, Mike Preston, Max Phipps, Vernon Wells. Cinematography by Dean Semler, Music by Brian May. Written by Terry Hayes and George Miller.

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description:
Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution.
Made in conjunction with the Frankston Police Community Involvement Programme and Frankston TAFE.

results.title: The Man on the beat
results.creator_credit: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The duties and training of a London policeman, known over the world for his courtesy. The London policeman is unarmed, and his duties vary from finding lost children to directing traffic. Dealing with crime is only an occasional part of the ordinary London policeman’s job.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Murray, Ralph Kemplen, Roger MacDougall and Merlin Films

results.title: The Long journey
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: War has left its mark on Korea. Three million refugees joined the ranks of the homeless and hungry and the countryside was maimed and scarred. This film tells of Kim Tai Yung, a farmer from North Korea and one of those refugees who made their way to the South and freedom in 1951. As a background to Kim’s gradual progress the task of United Nations rehabilitation and reconstruction is seen to take shape and move into action.

results.title: Our peninsula
results.brief_description: A personal narrative by Jenny Macaffer about her family’s relationship with the Mornington Peninsula over three generations using photographic images and computer animation. Pipe music performed by the Rats of Tobruk Memorial Highland Band 1984.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.

results.title: Alternate interfaces

constellations_other.name: Dream A Little Crazy: The next stage of human evolution
constellations_other.description: Collaborators Lucy McRae and Rachel Wingfield created a ‘biological bakery’ for Architecture In Helsinki’s "Dream A Little Crazy". Manufacturing a series of mass-produced band members the clip explores speculative science and the future of the human body’s evolution.

results.description: Stelarc’s Alternate Interfaces explores the human/machine divide.
